text:
I am running jsdk 1.4.1_02 with Tomcat 4.1.24.

When I start Tomcat as a service, the Administration app does not work. I get 
the status 500 message below. When I run this standalone on the machine, the 
problem does not occur.

I also noticed that if I go into the Admin app under standalone, then start as 
an NT service, the app works. But, I have to access each admin function under 
standalone for them to work once started as a service.

HTTP Status 500 -

message 

description The server encountered an internal error () that prevented it from 
fulfilling this request.

An error occurred at line: -1 in the jsp file: null

Generated servlet error:

creator: jcarney@seic.com

text:
have the same problem: Tomcat 4.1.24 JDK 1.4.0 JSP can't compile as service but 
run well as application:
bypass it by uninstall the service and reinstall it with the command (not 
completly correct at least no stdout and use bootstrap not bootstapService as 
initial install have done, sorry I don't have keep a copy of the original 
registry entry)

d:\Tomcat41\bin\tomcat -uninstall "Apache Tomcat 4.1"

"d:\Tomcat41\bin\tomcat.exe" -install Tomcat "D:\j2sdk1.4.0
\jre\bin\client\jvm.dll"  -Djava.class.path="d:\Tomcat41
\bin\bootstrap.jar;D:\j2sdk1.4.0\lib\tools.jar" -Dcatalina.home="d:\Tomcat41" -
Xrs -start org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap -params start -stop 
org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap -params stop -
out "d:\Tomcat41"\logs\stderr.log

if this can help
JLD
creator: jlduval11@hotmail.com

text: Sorry not fix was supposed to stay at NEW, just some precision
creator: jlduval11@hotmail.com

text:
Please do not reopen this "bug", which have been filed many many times, and be
more careful when installing Tomcat (it is not flawless, obviously, and will be
made more robust in 5.0.x).
As a workaround, copy %JAVA_HOME%/lib/tools.jar to %CATALINA_HOME%/common/lib.
creator: remm@apache.org
